intro: Acridocarpus congolensis, commonly known as the Congo acridocarpus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and Southern Africa, particularly the Democratic Republic of the Congo. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture, while the fruit is a small, three-lobed drupe.
